answers.answer: NL,You report tingling in the upper and lower extremities and recent right facial/head involvement which worsens when you get worried about your condition.  It appears that at least some portion of your symptoms are related to anxiety(because they got worse with anxiety).  Your physician is evaluating you for physical conditions that can also present in this fashion which is important.  If physical conditions are ruled out then it would not be uncommon for these symptoms to be primarily anxiety related.  Hope this was helpful.Keep in mind that the information provided in this forum is intended for educational purposes only and you should see your personal physician for specific health concerns.Sincerely,HFHS MD-JMKeywords:  Anxiety, paresthesia
I received an email that an answer had been posted to this question...no answer yet

I had panic disorder about 12 years ago and those tingling sensations were certainly part of it.  I was convinced that there was something seriously  wrong with me.  I had other symtoms as well including palpitations, inability to take a deep breath and just constant nervousness.  I guess there are new drugs coming out all the time but I was put on Xanax which calmed me down and the symtoms were quickly gone. My doctor tried giving me an anti-depressant to use with the xanax but that just made it worse.  I was able to get off the xanax and was better in about 6 months.  I believe my problem was a chemical imbalance. Just a thought.

question: About 3 weeks ago I started having tingling sensations in both my lower legs and my lower arms.  I have been under the care of a doctor, who has run blood work (thyroid, diabetes, cbc and folate checks)  I also have an appointment next week to see a neurologist.  Within the last several days, I notice the tingling getting worse, and I also get tingling sensations on the right side of my face and on my head.  My doctor has me on Ativan to supposedly keep my calm.  For the last few days it hasnt been working, and every time I get upset or worried about my conditiion, the symptoms get worse!!  I am scared that I may have MS and I am wondering if I am bringing symptoms on mysellf by worrying about it so much.  Is it possible that all these symptoms could be simply from anxiety/stress?  Please someone, help me.
title: what wrong with me?
